title: Book 5 - Upper-Intermediate Level

words.meaning: to stop and hold something that is moving
words.example: The goalkeeper caught the ball.
Smoking causes lung cancer.

words.meaning: to do something special for an important event
words.example: We celebrated her birthday with a party.

words.meaning: something difficult that tests your ability
words.example: Learning a new language is a challenge.
The weather changed from sunny to rainy.

words.meaning: to ask for money for something
words.example: The restaurant charges $20 for dinner.
Please check your work before submitting.
I chose the blue shirt over the red one.
He claims he didn't see the sign.
The kitchen is very clean.

words.meaning: easy to understand or see through
words.example: The instructions are very clear.
The store is close to my house.
I collect stamps from different countries.

words.meaning: to join or mix things together
words.example: Combine the flour and eggs to make dough.

words.meaning: to move toward someone or something
words.example: Come here and sit down.
Let's compare the two products.
I need to complete this report by Friday.
Please consider all the options.
This box contains old photographs.
Please continue with your story.

description: Upper-intermediate level English vocabulary with advanced academic and professional terms.
